subject: Re: Guidance Required: Introducing New Premium Range

full_threads.body: (Time: 60mins)

Hi Amy and Brooke,

Thank you so much for your patience, we’ve now wrapped up the staging check and here’s what we found:

1. Moving SKUs to a new product
  • In the Selection Phase: if I have a Side Table category with the SKU “Amara Side 12345” linked to “Amara Side,” and I move that SKU to a newly created product “Amara Side Premium,” the team is no longer able to scan the SKU.

2. Moving a product to a different category
  • We tested an order for “Ada 3 Seat Sofa Natural – 3 Seat Sofa.”
    When moving “Ada 3 Seat Sofa Natural” from 3 Seat Sofa to 3 Seat Sofa Premium:
    • SKU scanning continued to work smoothly
    • Pricing stayed consistent with 3 Seat Sofa
    • Orders moved successfully through Confirm → Delivered → Processing
    • Returns also worked fine for “Ada 3 Seat Sofa Natural”
    • Reports show the full history of the product, including when it was in 3 Seat Sofa and when it was moved to 3 Seat Sofa Premium

Suggestions / Notes
  • Best to avoid moving existing SKUs into a new product.
  • Instead, move the full product into the Premium category.
  • Pricing will remain the same for submitted orders, but when a new product is added to existing orders it will display the updated pricing.
  • Reports will display the full history of the product, including when it was in 3 Seat Sofa and when it was moved to 3 Seat Sofa Premium.

Overall, Brooke’s test scenario worked really well, which is great to see. Please let me know your thoughts, and if you’d like us to run any further checks on our side.

Hello,

Any updates on this please?

Kind Regards,

AMY SMITH CEO | CREATIVE DIRECTOR
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Brooke,

Thanks for letting us know.

We’ve gone ahead and removed the description as requested.

We’re still finalising the SKU testing in staging and will keep you posted with an update tomorrow or Monday at the latest.

Appreciate your patience.

Hi Joel,

Can you please remove the description field which creates this "i" button for all premium parent categories. We've added it to the actual name of the category to really spell it out for clients.



Thank you.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 30mins)

Hi Amy,

Thank you for your message.

We’ll set up a process that runs through all the draft quotes (around 1,200+) and updates them with the latest pricing on December 1st. That way everything will be aligned with the new rates from that date. Let me know if this works for you?

@Brooke, just confirming that the image has been updated to the “Premium Range” default. Can you please try now?

Thanks Joel.

Is it possible to explore how easy / hard it would be to change all draft quotes to the new pricing on the 1st of December please.

Kind Regards,

AMY SMITH CEO | CREATIVE DIRECTOR
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Joel,

Can you please change all premium category images, to the image attached. Ie, the 2.5 Seat Sofa - Premium feature image should be the attached image, not the same image as the 2.5 Seat Sofa in the core range.



Also, we cannot see these categories, on the retail site, which is fine as we actually want to hide this premium range from our retail customers, but I just wanted to flag that with you. Was that intentional?

Please confirm once above change has been actioned so we can send out our client comms.

Thanks so much.

Kind Regards,





BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Amy,

I hope you’re doing really well.

Just to clarify on your question:
  • Any draft quotes created prior to 1st October 2025 will keep their original pricing when they’re pushed through as an order.
  • If a client edits that draft quote and adds any new items after 1st October, those new items will automatically reflect the updated pricing.
  • At the moment, the system doesn’t have a way to bulk update all existing draft quotes to the new pricing. That would need to be done manually, though we can certainly look into possible custom options if that’s something you’d like us to explore.

This approach means you’ll be able to honor the pre-October pricing on drafts through to the end of the year, while still ensuring any new additions pick up the updated rates.

Let me know if this works for you, happy to help.

Hi Joel,

Thank you for your help with this.

Can you please also answer Brooke's question…"We have another question for you. If a client has a draft quote in the system, generated prior to 1st October 2025, is there a way to honor that pricing if that draft quote gets pushed through as an order, until the end of the year. We want to cap it until then. And then is there a way to update all draft quotes in the system to reflect the new pricing?"



Thank you.

Kind Regards,

AMY SMITH CEO | CREATIVE DIRECTOR
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 90mins)

Hi Brooke,

Thank you so much for sending through the updated premium pricing and categories — that’s really clear and helpful.

I’ve gone ahead and set up the new parent categories with the pricing you outlined. You can now add in the dummy products, and once they’re in place they’ll be available in the list for quoting.

In terms of draft quotes, the pricing will remain as originally generated, so those can still be honored. However, once a client begins adding any new items after 1st October, the updated pricing will automatically apply. I’d recommend we run a quick test in staging just to make sure everything works as expected, especially since there are quite a few draft quotes in the system.

I’ll also be on standby on October 1st to support the transition, and you’re always welcome to email us at support@wolfiq.com.au if anything comes up.

Thanks again, really appreciate you sending this through, and happy to assist.

Hi Joel,

Yes that would be great if you can please proceed with setting up the new parent categories for the premium range. The spreadsheet I sent you yesterday had a lot of detail you don't need in it (and we have also made a number of changes), so please don't go by that. I have included the categories and pricing below that we need set up:



  • 2.5 Seat Sofa - Premium $72


  • 3 Seat Sofa - Premium $92


  • 4 Seat Sofa / Sofa with Chaise - Premium $126


  • Armchair / Occasional Chair - Premium $36


  • Bedside Tale - Premium $20


  • Coffee Table - Premium $34


  • Dining / Desk Chair - Premium $19


  • Dining Table - Large Rectangular - Premium $75


  • Dining Table - Large Round - Premium $52


  • Headboard Double - Premium $33


  • Headboard King - Premium $45


  • Headboard Queen - Premium $38


  • Outdoor Armchair / Occasional Chair - Premium $46


  • Outdoor Coffee Table - Premium $20


  • Outdoor Dining Chair - Premium $19


  • Outdoor Sofa - Premium $96


  • Outdoor Sunlounger - Premium $27


  • Outdoor Dining Table Large - Premium $78



With regard to the pricing increase across the broader core range, as well as delivery fees, we do not want this to take affect until 1st October 2025. So please do not make any changes to our broader pricing until then. We will provide you with the new pricing closer to the time.

Can you please confirm once the above categories have been set up and we will create dummy products to attach to these so that clients can begin quoting on the new premium range, which they will be able to select from as of 1st October. When do you think this will be actioned as we are hoping to email the clients today.

I have attached an example of the tile place holder we will use until 1st October.

We have another question for you. If a client has a draft quote in the system, generated prior to 1st October 2025, is there a way to honor that pricing if that draft quote gets pushed through as an order, until the end of the year. We want to cap it until then. And then is there a way to update all draft quotes in the system to reflect the new pricing?

Thank you for your work on this.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Brooke,

Thanks so much for sharing the extra details, really appreciate it.

We’ve been testing in staging and will send you our feedback shortly — a few things have already come up that we’ll outline for you.

Just wanted to check with you — are you happy for us to go ahead and create all the premiums on the live site with the details below? We’ll also be adding the pricing, though there aren’t any products linked to these premium pricing tiers just yet.

Thanks so much.

Kind Regards,

02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Joel,

Thank you for your email however we are hoping for more clarification around things and need a response fairly urgently as we are wanting to roll this out by close of business today.

Firstly, can you please confirm that you tested what happens to a product and it's allocated SKU, if it is already assigned to an order (be that in selection, confirmed, delivered, processing), and then it undergoes the transition from core range to premium. We need to be sure your findings aligned with ours and that there are no major implications at an SKU level, because your initial suggestion to delete all core range SKU's and set them up again with new premium range SKU's is definitely not an option.

Secondly, not only are we introducing a new premium range at a higher price point, but as of October 1st, we will be increasing our prices across the board (see new pricing attached). Can you please confirm that:


  • All draft quotes created prior to 1st October will maintain current prices


  • Only new quotes created on or after 1st October should reflect the updated pricing



Can you please schedule this pricing update, early in the morning of the 1st October. And can you please confirm if you are able to have someone on standby in case there are any technical issues with the launch of the new premium range and the price increase.

With regard to the tile/graphic for the Premium Range, can you please update to the below wording and send us the graphic file in JPG or PNG format:

Premium Range
Available for selection from 1st October 2025.

NB: This above mentioned tile will replace the below tile and will be used for both the Parent and Child Category from now until 1st October.



It will then be replaced by the below tile at Parent category level. At child category level the tiles will populate with the actual product that will be live for selection from 1st October. We will need the below tiles created and uploaded to the following parent categories (this is not urgent - we won't be using these tiles until 1st October):



  • 2.5 Seat Sofa - Premium


  • 3 Seat Sofa - Premium


  • 4 Seat Sofa / Sofa with Chaise - Premium


  • Armchair / Occasional Chair - Premium


  • Bedside Table - Premium


  • Buffet / Sideboard - Premium


  • Coffee Table - Premium


  • Dining / Desk Chair - Premium


  • Dining Table Large Rectangular - Premium


  • Dining Table Large Round - Premium


  • Headboard Double - Premium


  • Headboard King - Premium


  • Headboard Queen - Premium


  • Outdoor Armchair / Occasional Chair - Premium


  • Outdoor Coffee Table - Premium


  • Outdoor Dining Chair - Premium


  • Outdoor Sofa Premium


  • Outdoor Sunlounger - Premium


  • Outdoor Dining Table Large - Premium



Can you please move the star into the upper right hand corner of the box and make it the blush colour (same as the product colour).



Thank you Joel, please let me know if you have any questions.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSONBUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER

AMY SMITH CEO | CREATIVE DIRECTOR

Hi Joel,

Sorry to press you on this, just wanted to check in and see how you are going with your testing. I thought it might be helpful to share some testing I did in-house today. See the steps I took below:



  1. Draft quote created for Occasional Chair x 1 (core range)


  2. Submitted the order, approved the date, order now sitting in selection tab


  3. Allocated Theodore Velvet Occasional Chair Onyx


  4. Confirmed the order so the job was ready to pick and scan in warehouse


  5. All SKU's appeared as per normal to assign to order (see screenshot below). Did not assign SKU.









  2. Went into back end and set up new product category Z Test Armchair / Occasional Chair Premium


  3. Looked up Theodore Velvet Occasional Chair Onyx back end, unassigned it from its existing category and reassigned it to Z Test Armchair / Occasional Chair Premium


  4. Went back into the order front end (in confirmed tab) to scan the product out and it still appeared as an SKU option, despite having changed from core to premium category (as per screenshot below). This is a win!








  1. Assigned the SKU to the order and moved it into delivered.


  2. Booked the pick up for this order in the system so that the job was then sitting in processing











  2. Was able to return the SKU back into inventory with no issues



I also tested what happens if I removed the assigned product from the order (while in selections, confirmed and delivered) and tried to re assign it AFTER I had transitioned the categories back end. As suspected, once I unassigned the product from the order it was no longer an option to select when I attempted to reassign it back to the order (because the product was no longer sitting in it's original core range category). What this tells me is that the transition won't affect products already on orders (prior to transition), it will only affect products added to orders once the transition has been made. Which is exactly what we want.

Also, important to note that once a product was scanned back in at processing and the job moved to collected, the product was only available for selection in the new category (also what we want):



Thanks Joel.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Brooke,

Thanks so much for sharing the details—we really appreciate it.

We’ll circle back with you as soon as possible with an update.

Hi Joel,

I just wanted to check in and see what your thoughts were on our below work around.

We're keen to get some comms out to clients asap around this new range asap. Appreciate there is some complexity around it.

Thanks so much.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU

Hi Joel,

Retiring all of the SKU's we wish to transition into the premium range, and recoding all that stock, is not a feasible option for us. There are hundreds and hundreds of pieces. We did some testing in house yesterday and think there could be a work around. We have stepped it out below.

Background

As previously explained, we are introducing a new Premium product category (e.g. Premium Three-Seat Sofas). These products already exist in the site under their current categories (e.g. Three-Seat Sofas), but from 1 October we want them to sit under new Premium categories instead. We plan to notify clients this week about the upcoming launch, so they can begin quoting for jobs that go out in October.

Rollout Steps & Timeframe

Step 1 - This Friday (pre-launch setup)


  • Create the new Premium categories in the backend (e.g. Premium Three-Seat Sofas).


  • I believe that each category must contain at least one product in order to show up in quotes.


  • We propose adding a dummy product tile (see example below) in each Premium category, with messaging such as:



"Premium Three-Seat Sofas launching 1 October. If you'd like to select from our Premium range for jobs from this date onwards, please price accordingly." This ensures clients can start including Premium items in quotes now, with the note that they are available for selection from 1 October. We need to refine the wording we will use here but we basically want to advise clients to allow a buffer in their quotes to account for premium products.



Step 2 - 1 October (go-live switch)


  • Reassign the relevant products from their current categories into the new Premium categories.


  • Example: Adele Three-Seat Sofa currently sits under "3-Seat Sofas." On 1 October, untick "3-Seat Sofas" and tick "Premium 3-Seat Sofas.


  • Important: SKUs must not be deleted or recoded - this is a large volume of product and only category reassignment is possible.



SKU status management
We need confirmation on how products behave when their category is changed while they are attached to jobs at different statuses:


  • Selection phase - If a client has Adele 3 Seat Sofa selected under the standard 3 Seat Sofa category prior to 1 October, will it remain on their order at the original pricing after the category is reassigned to Premium 3 Seat Sofa?


  • Confirmed / Delivered / Processing - Will the product remain on those jobs as a normal sofa until completion?


  • Returns - Once the product is returned, will it then automatically move into the Premium category going forward?



Our Request

Can you please test and confirm:


  • That categories will show up in quotes with a dummy product in them.


  • That product categories can be changed (without SKU recoding) and function correctly.


  • That jobs already in selection/confirmed/delivered/processing are unaffected and pricing remains stable (i.e. if a job is in delivered and the Adele 3 Seat Sofa changes to Premium, the price of the ongoing rate won't change).


  • That products automatically fall under their new Premium category once returned.



From the limited testing we've done, it looks like this workflow should work, but we want to ensure all scenarios are covered before launch.

Unfortunately, the new website will not be ready to launch prior to introducing this new category. We therefore need to resolve this within the current site. Our goal is to have the Premium categories available to quote by the end of this week and available to select the premium products by the 1st of October.

We look forward to your thoughts on this. Thanks Joel.

Kind Regards,

BROOKE WILKINSON BUYER | BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
 02 8310 2285 BROOKE@HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU HUNTLEYANDCO.COM.AU
(Time: 15mins)
